quote: The philosophy of Atheism represents a concept of life without any metaphysical Beyond or Divine Regulator. It is the concept of an actual, real world with its liberating, expanding and beautifying possibilities, as against an unreal world, which, with its spirits, oracles, and mean contentment has kept humanity in helpless degradation.
author: Emma Goldman,  Anarchism and Other Essays

quote: Atheism is more than just the knowledge that gods do not exist, and that religion is either a mistake or a fraud. Atheism is an attitude, a frame of mind that looks at the world objectively, fearlessly, always trying to understand all things as a part of nature.
author: Emmett F. Fields

quote: Atheism, a religion dedicated to its own sense of smug superiority.
author: Stephen Colbert

quote: Atheism is a way of humility. It's to think oneself to be an animal, as we are actually and to allow oneself to become human.
author: André Comte-Sponville,  Presentations de La Philosophie

quote: Atheism, true 'existential' atheism burning with hatred of a seemingly unjust or unmerciful God, is a spiritual state; it is a real attempt to grapple with the true God.… Nietzsche, in calling himself Antichrist, proved thereby his intense hunger for Christ.
author: Seraphim Rose,  Nihilism: The Root of the Revolution of the Modern Age

quote: An atheist believes that a hospital should be built instead of a church. An atheist believes that deed must be done instead of prayer said.An atheist strives for involvement in life and not escape into death. He wants disease conquered, poverty vanished, war eliminated.
author: Madalyn Murray O'Hair

quote: If there is a God, atheism must seem to Him as less of an insult than religion.
author: Edmond de Goncourt

quote: No it's not!"said Constable Visit. "Atheism is a denial of a god.""Therefore It Is A Religious Position,"said Dorfl. "Indeed, A True Atheist Thinks Of The Gods Constantly, Albeit In Terms of Denial. Therefore, Atheism Is A Form Of Belief. If The Atheist Truly Did Not Believe, He Or She Would Not Bother To Deny.
author: Terry Pratchett,  Feet of Clay

quote: My atheism, like that of Spinoza, is true piety towards the universe and denies only gods fashioned by men in their own image, to be servants of their human interests.
author: George Santayana,  Soliloquies in England & Later Soliloquies

quote: Properly read, the Bible is the most potent force for atheism ever conceived.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Atheism [10w] Atheism is the tragic triumph of cold contemptuousness over gratitude.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: The more I read arguments for atheism, the more I am convinced it takes a very strong faith to be an atheist. And atheism seems to me the least reasonable of all faiths.
author: Corrado Ghinamo,  The Beautiful Scientist: A Spiritual Approach to Science

quote: If Atheism is a religion, then health is a disease!
author: Clark Adams

quote: To sustain the belief that there is no God, atheism has to demonstrate infinite knowledge, which is tantamount to saying, “I have infinite knowledge that there is no being in existence with infinite knowledge
author: Ravi Zacharias

quote: Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning...
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: I do not believe in God and I am not an atheist.
author: Albert Camus,  Notebooks 1951-1959

quote: ...atheism is not a conscious act of turning away from all gods. It is simply the final destination for those who think. ...you will be pleased to discover that the sky does not fall down on your head. ... if you still want to pray, you can (the success rate of your prayers is unlikely to change).
author: Guy P. Harrison

quote: The religionist is a living fossil, embedded in that rock called faith.
author: Robert G. Ingersoll

quote: I’m an atheist, and a militant atheist when religion starts impacting on legislation.
author: Daniel Radcliffe

quote: The atheist has no hope.
author: James Freeman Clarke

quote: The whole war between the atheist and the theist comes down to this: the atheist believes a 'what' created the universe; the theist believes a 'who' created the universe.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: I'm probably 20 percent atheist and 80 percent agnostic. I don't think anyone really knows. You'll either find out or not when you get there, until then there's no point thinking about it.
author: Brad Pitt

quote: Belief means not wanting to know what is true.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: I’m an atheist and I thank God for it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Religion, n. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: It would be the height of absurdity to label ignorance tempered by humility "faith"!(Institutio III.2.3)
author: John Calvin

quote: The opposite of the religious fanatic is not the fanatical atheist but the gentle cynic who cares not whether there is a god or not.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Religion. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: ...I am not, however, militant in my atheism. The great English theoretical physicist Paul Dirac is a militant atheist. I suppose he is interested in arguing about the existence of God. I am not. It was once quipped that there is no God and Dirac is his prophet.
author: Linus Pauling

quote: The atheist staring from his attic window is often nearer to God than the believer caught up in his own false image of God.
author: Martin Buber

quote: All thinking men are atheists.
author: Ernest Hemingway,  A Farewell to Arms

quote: Those who believe that they believe in God, but without passion in their hearts, without anguish in mind, without uncertainty, without doubt, without an element of despair even in their consolation, believe only in the God idea, not God Himself.
author: Miguel de Unamuno

quote: I think religion is a neurological disorder.
author: Bill Maher

quote: Religion is about turning untested belief into unshakable truth through the power of institutions and the passage of time.
author: Richard Dawkins

quote: The typical atheist rebels against God as a teenager rebels against his parents. When his own desires or standards are not fulfilled in the way that he sees fit, he, in revolt, storms out of the house in denial of the Word of God and in scrutiny of a great deal of those who stand by the Word of God. The epithet 'Heavenly Father' is a grand reflection, a relation to that of human nature.
author: Criss Jami,  Killosophy

quote: Atheists are my brothers and sisters of a different faith, and every word they speak speaks of faith. Like me, they go as far as the legs of reason will carry them -- and then they leap.
author: Yann Martel

quote: Religion's just a well-oiled profit-driven denial of the randomness of it all.
author: Wally Lamb

quote: There are, as we know, powerful and illustrious atheists. At bottom, led back to the truth by their very force, they are not absolutely sure that they are atheists; it is with them only a question of definition, and in any case, if they do not believe in God, being great minds, they prove God.
author: Victor Hugo,  Les Misérables

quote: I am a religious person, although I am not a believer.
author: Philip Pullman

quote: All children are atheists, they have no idea of God.
author: Paul Henri Thiry d'Holbach,  System of Nature

quote: There are no atheists in the foxhole.
author: Ernie Pyle

quote: God has no religion.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities, can make you commit atrocities.
author: Voltaire,  Questions sur les Miracles à M. Claparede, Professeur de Théologie à Genève, par un Proposant: Ou Extrait de Diverses Lettres de M. de Voltaire

quote: If you drop your beliefs, you drop your success. God's mighty people begin to fall even as achievers when they begin to drop the beliefs they pursue at first.
author: Israelmore Ayivor,  The Great Hand Book of Quotes

quote: You could just as well say that an agnostic is a deeply religious person with at least a rudimentary knowledge of human fallibility.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: This mindless tolerance, which places observable scientific facts, subject to proof, on the same level as unprovable supernatural fantasy, has played a major role in the resurgence of both anti-intellectualism and anti-rationalism.
author: Susan Jacoby,  The Age of American Unreason

quote: It is easier for a Russian to become an Atheist, than for any other nationality in the world. And not only does a Russian 'become an Atheist,' but he actually BELIEVES IN Atheism, just as though he had found a new faith, not perceiving that he has pinned his faith to a negation. Such is our anguish of thirst!
author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky,  The Idiot

quote: The worst moment for the atheist is when he is really thankful and has nobody to thank.
author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti

quote: When one person suffers from a delusion, it is called insanity. When many people suffer from a delusion it is called a Religion.
author: Robert M. Pirsig,  Zen and the Art of Motorcycle Maintenance: An Inquiry Into Values

quote: A young man who wishes to remain a sound atheist cannot be too careful of his reading.
author: C.S. Lewis,  Surprised by Joy: The Shape of My Early Life
